main event: A UFO sighting occurred on 6 November 1957 in the North Atlantic Ocean, involving two bright lights moving across the sky from east to west.
interesting points: The sighting took place at 2300 EST and lasted for 3 minutes.
The source of the report was a civilian, indicating a non-military witness.
There were no photographs of the observed objects.
The conclusion suggested that the sighting was likely the Aurora borealis.
The objects were described as 'very prominent' in the sky.
sighted object: two bright lights in the sky
